snippet: The Institute for Supply Management said its manufacturing index slid to 51.1 in August from 52.7 in July. A strong dollar and China’s lagging economy took their toll.
abstract: Institute for Supply Management reports manufacturing index for August declined from 52.7 in July to 51.1, second decline in row; report implies slowing Chinese growth and strong dollar may be hurting American manufacturers and maybe overall economy as well; Commerce Dept reports construction spending increased 0.7 percent in July.
lead_paragraph: The Institute for Supply Management said its manufacturing index slid to 51.1 in August from 52.7 in July. A strong dollar and China’s lagging economy took their toll.

headline.main: Growth at U.S. Factories Falls, but Construction Spending Reaches a 7-Year High
headline.print_headline: Growth at U.S. Factories Falls, but Construction Spending Reaches a 7-Year High
